intro: Didymocarpus lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myroblan, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
